Pre-Game Insights: The match on June 6th, 2024, marks Sunil Chhetri’s final appearance in the national jersey for India.
India’s recent performance showcases a team with many flaws in the defensive department and an attacking department that failed to find the back of the net in recent games.
India is yet to win an international match in 2024, having scored only one goal and conceded eight.
Kuwait’s performance has been inconsistent recently, securing wins against Bahrain, Syria, and Afghanistan, yet facing bitter defeats in key World Cup qualifier matches.
Kuwait has conceded 10 goals in their last 5 matches.
India’s squad presents a mix of seasoned players and emerging talents, with key players like Sandesh Jhingan, Pritam Kotal, and Ashique Kuruniyan missing from the squad.
Kuwait’s coach, Rui Bento, enjoys the advantage of a full-strength squad with notable players like Yousef Nasser and Faisal Zayed.
Historically, India and Kuwait have had several encounters, with India generally having the upper hand.
In their most recent clash during the first leg of the WC qualifiers, the game ended in a 1-0 win in favor of India.
India’s recent victory in the SAFF Championship final in 2023 against Kuwait gives them a slight upper hand from a mentality point of view.

Probable starting lineups for India: Gurpreet Singh Sandhu (GK), Anwar Ali, Subhashish Bose, Mehtab Singh, Akash Mishra, Sahal Abdul Samad, Anirudh Thapa, Suresh Singh Wangjam, Sunil Chhetri (C), Liston Colaco, Manvir Singh.

Probable starting lineups for Kuwait: Sulaiman Abdulghafoor (GK), Hassan-Al-Enezi, Khaled Ebrahim, Rashed-Al-Dosary, Mohsen Ghareeb, Ahmad Al-Dhefiri, Redha Hani, Hamad-Al-Harbi, Faisal Zayed, Mohammad Daham, Yousef Nasser (C).
IFTWC predicts a 1-0 win for the Blue Tigers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The FIFA World Cup 2026 qualifier match between India and Kuwait will telecast live on the Sports18 Network and will also be streamed live on Jio Cinema.
